00015 #ifndef __etc1_h__
00016 #define __etc1_h__
00017 
00018 #define ETC1_ENCODED_BLOCK_SIZE 8
00019 #define ETC1_DECODED_BLOCK_SIZE 48
00020 
00021 #ifndef ETC1_RGB8_OES
00022 #define ETC1_RGB8_OES 0x8D64
00023 #endif
00024 
00025 typedef unsigned char etc1_byte;
00026 typedef int etc1_bool;
00027 typedef unsigned int etc1_uint32;
00028 
00029 #ifdef __cplusplus
00030 extern "C" {
00031 #endif
00032 
00033 // Encode a block of pixels.
00034 //
00035 // pIn is a pointer to a ETC_DECODED_BLOCK_SIZE array of bytes that represent a
00036 // 4 x 4 square of 3-byte pixels in form R, G, B. Byte (3 * (x + 4 * y) is the R
00037 // value of pixel (x, y).
00038 //
00039 // validPixelMask is a 16-bit mask where bit (1 << (x + y * 4)) indicates whether
00040 // the corresponding (x,y) pixel is valid. Invalid pixel color values are ignored when compressing.
00041 //
00042 // pOut is an ETC1 compressed version of the data.
00043 
00044 void etc1_encode_block(const etc1_byte* pIn, etc1_uint32 validPixelMask, etc1_byte* pOut);
00045 
00046 // Decode a block of pixels.
00047 //
00048 // pIn is an ETC1 compressed version of the data.
00049 //
00050 // pOut is a pointer to a ETC_DECODED_BLOCK_SIZE array of bytes that represent a
00051 // 4 x 4 square of 3-byte pixels in form R, G, B. Byte (3 * (x + 4 * y) is the R
00052 // value of pixel (x, y).
00053 
00054 void etc1_decode_block(const etc1_byte* pIn, etc1_byte* pOut);
00055 
00056 // Return the size of the encoded image data (does not include size of PKM header).
00057 
00058 etc1_uint32 etc1_get_encoded_data_size(etc1_uint32 width, etc1_uint32 height);
00059 
00060 // Encode an entire image.
00061 // pIn - pointer to the image data. Formatted such that
00062 //       pixel (x,y) is at pIn + pixelSize * x + stride * y;
00063 // pOut - pointer to encoded data. Must be large enough to store entire encoded image.
00064 // pixelSize can be 2 or 3. 2 is an GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5 image, 3 is a GL_BYTE RGB image.
00065 // returns non-zero if there is an error.
00066 
00067 int etc1_encode_image(const etc1_byte* pIn, etc1_uint32 width, etc1_uint32 height,
00068         etc1_uint32 pixelSize, etc1_uint32 stride, etc1_byte* pOut);
00069 
00070 // Decode an entire image.
00071 // pIn - pointer to encoded data.
00072 // pOut - pointer to the image data. Will be written such that
00073 //        pixel (x,y) is at pIn + pixelSize * x + stride * y. Must be
00074 //        large enough to store entire image.
00075 // pixelSize can be 2 or 3. 2 is an GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5 image, 3 is a GL_BYTE RGB image.
00076 // returns non-zero if there is an error.
00077 
00078 int etc1_decode_image(const etc1_byte* pIn, etc1_byte* pOut,
00079         etc1_uint32 width, etc1_uint32 height,
00080         etc1_uint32 pixelSize, etc1_uint32 stride);
00081 
00082 // Size of a PKM header, in bytes.
00083 
00084 #define ETC_PKM_HEADER_SIZE 16
00085 
00086 // Format a PKM header
00087 
00088 void etc1_pkm_format_header(etc1_byte* pHeader, etc1_uint32 width, etc1_uint32 height);
00089 
00090 // Check if a PKM header is correctly formatted.
00091 
00092 etc1_bool etc1_pkm_is_valid(const etc1_byte* pHeader);
00093 
00094 // Read the image width from a PKM header
00095 
00096 etc1_uint32 etc1_pkm_get_width(const etc1_byte* pHeader);
00097 
00098 // Read the image height from a PKM header
00099 
00100 etc1_uint32 etc1_pkm_get_height(const etc1_byte* pHeader);
00101 
00102 #ifdef __cplusplus
00103 }
00104 #endif
